definitions.definition: To exclude; to specify as being an exception.
To take exception, to object (to or against).
definitions.example: to except to a witness or his testimony
There was nothing in the cupboard except a tin of beans.

definitions.definition: With the exception (that); used to introduce a clause, phrase or adverb forming an exception or qualification to something previously stated.
definitions.example: I never made fun of her except teasingly.

definitions.definition: Unless; used to introduce a hypothetical case in which an exception may exist.
